title: News & Features
content:
Across much of the United States, the first leaves and flowers of common garden plants are emerging earlier in the spring than they used to. It's a different story in the Southeast.
Commonly requested images related to El Niño and La Niña
Maps of U.S. and global climate for print and presentation
Stories and graphics from NOAA's 2020 Arctic Report Card
Tracking natural and human-caused climate change
After facing 5 years of drought in 15 years, partners in Washington's Yakima River Basin developed a new water plan that aims to make farms, fish, and families in the region more resilient to climate variability and change.
